Hero.headline: Management × Engineering: Powering Physical AI.
Hero.headlineJa: Integrating management insight with engineering excellence to deliver real-world Physical AI.
Hero.name: Kousei Osawa
Hero.affiliation: Kyoto Univ. Economics | NEDO NEP FR

Vision.title: Vision & Activities
Vision.subtitle: Technology implementation and community building, working in tandem.
Vision.description: I am working on the social implementation of "Physical AI" — autonomous systems operating in the physical world — to address Japan's structural challenge of labor shortages. My activities are structured around two axes: the "KVT Project," which aims at technology implementation and commercialization, and "KUPAC," a Physical AI community originating from Kyoto.
Vision.kupacTagline: A Physical AI community connecting research and industry
Vision.kupacDescription: KUPAC is a Physical AI-focused community that aims to connect the research knowledge of Kyoto University with the industrial challenges of companies in the Kansai region.
Vision.kupacStat1Value: Approximately 300 participants within 6 months of founding (students, researchers, engineers, companies)
Vision.kupacStat2Value: Endorsed by Kyoto University's Growth Strategy Division; incorporated as KUPAC LLC
Vision.kupacStat3Value: Physical AI talent development, knowledge sharing, and joint research & technology validation
Vision.kvtTagline: A social implementation project born from KUPAC
Vision.kvtDescription: KVT, where I serve as project leader, is a project born from KUPAC's activities. We tackle labor shortages that are difficult to solve with software alone, using an approach that combines AI with robotics.
Vision.kvtStat1Value: Selected for NEDO NEP Frontier Course 2025
Vision.kvtStat2Value: Full-scratch development of a dual-arm robot for Physical AI social implementation
Vision.kvtStat3Value: Aiming to create a model case where technology addresses social challenges, as a startup from KUPAC

Portfolio.title: Technical Portfolio
Portfolio.subtitle: Technical domains spanning Web, low-level systems, and robotics
Portfolio.webSummary: From website operations to SaaS development
Portfolio.webItem1Desc: Generative AI SaaS with user registration and payment features. Full serverless architecture centered on AWS Lambda + Terraform IaC. Achieved ~100 MAU
Portfolio.webItem1Detail: Provides automated report generation using the Gemini API. Built a React CSR frontend, with a serverless backend based on AWS Lambda + SQS. Integrated Stripe for payments and managed infrastructure as code with Terraform. (Currently paused due to long-term maintenance.)
Portfolio.webItem2Desc: Website operations as community infrastructure, SEO optimization, reached 700 monthly visitors, Discord app integration, etc.
Portfolio.webItem2Detail: A multilingual community website built with Next.js + next-intl. Implemented SEO optimization, OGP support, and Discord bot integration. Currently maintained by a successor within the community.
Portfolio.nativeSummary: From desktop applications to mobile apps
Portfolio.nativeItem1Desc: React Native app with custom Native Modules (Swift/Kotlin) utilizing OS features like NFC/Overlay. App store release planned for April 2026.
Portfolio.nativeItem1Detail: A cross-platform app based on React Native that implements OS-specific features such as NFC tag read/write and system overlay display through custom Swift/Kotlin native modules.
Portfolio.nativeItem2Desc: Desktop application built with WPF for dashboard display of results and data collection
Portfolio.nativeItem2Detail: A desktop application for visualizing anomaly sound detection results in manufacturing environments. Built the dashboard UI with WPF (C#/.NET), implementing real-time data collection and filtering features.
Portfolio.systemSummary: Theory and implementation of computer architecture
Portfolio.systemItem1Desc: Calculator including CPU and IO designed and implemented in HDL on FPGA
Portfolio.systemItem1Detail: Designed a CPU in Verilog HDL on a Xilinx Basys3 board. Implemented ALU, register file, and control unit from scratch, building a complete system with 7-segment display and button switch I/O control.
Portfolio.systemItem2Desc: Prototype USD rendering engine using Google Dawn (C++)
Portfolio.systemItem2Detail: A prototype engine for rendering USD format 3D models in a native environment using Google Dawn (C++ WebGPU implementation) as the backend.
Portfolio.infraSummary: From hybrid cloud configurations to RAG infrastructure
Portfolio.infraItem1Desc: Secure configuration hiding home IP with AWS Route53 + CloudFront + Nginx
Portfolio.infraItem1Detail: Securely accessing an on-premises server by managing DNS with a custom DDNS system via AWS Route 53 and utilizing Amazon CloudFront as a reverse proxy, with Nginx configured on the backend.
Portfolio.infraItem2Desc: Low-cost operational RAG infrastructure using AWS S3 Vector store + Bedrock Knowledge base
Portfolio.infraItem2Detail: Built a RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) pipeline for custom documents using Amazon Bedrock's Knowledge Base feature and S3 as a vector store. Adopted serverless architecture for cost optimization.
Portfolio.aiItem1Desc: Visual inspection system for manufacturing using object detection and OCR
Portfolio.aiItem1Detail: Developed an automated visual inspection system for manufacturing floors by integrating object detection models with OCR engines.
Portfolio.aiItem2Desc: Locally-contained multimodal generation environment using low-level libraries
Portfolio.aiItem2Detail: Developed a standalone multimodal generative system utilizing core libraries such as Transformers and Diffusers. By leveraging quantization techniques, I enabled large-scale model inference even in environments with limited GPU resources.
Portfolio.aiItem3Desc: Implementing Two Layer MLP from scratch using Julia
Portfolio.aiItem3Detail: MLP implementation in Julia running on CPU. Achieved 96.96% test accuracy on MNIST for training and evaluation. CNN and other architectures may be implemented in the future.
Portfolio.roboticsSummary: From Robocon competition to building a custom autonomy stack
Portfolio.roboticsItem1Desc: Robot system development using microcontrollers and ROS 2
Portfolio.roboticsItem1Detail: Led the development of a throwing arm control system for NHK Student Robot Contest 2025. Accomplished end-to-end system integration, including STM32-based motor control and ROS 2 high-level architecture. Honored with a Special Prize for the distinctive mechanical design and control of the arm.
Portfolio.roboticsItem2Desc: Full-scratch autonomous driving algorithm + simulator in C++
Portfolio.roboticsItem2Detail: A full-scratch autonomous driving stack implementing self-localization, path planning, and path following in C++. Also built a custom simulation environment for algorithm verification and visualization.
Portfolio.roboticsItem3Desc: Development of an autonomous navigation system using ROS 2, Gazebo, and Navigation 2
Portfolio.roboticsItem3Detail: Built an autonomous navigation system by combining ROS 2 with the Gazebo simulation environment and Navigation 2. Implemented end-to-end navigation behavior including path following and obstacle avoidance.

Timeline.title: Career Timeline
Timeline.subtitle: My journey so far
Timeline.e1Text: Graduated from Tokyo Metropolitan Toyama High School
Timeline.e2Text: Enrolled in Kyoto University, Faculty of Economics
Timeline.e3Text: Appointed Vice President of Kyoto University Mechanical Engineering Club
Timeline.e4Text: Worked as OA at Morimoto Lab, Graduate School of Informatics, Kyoto University — Physical AI research
Timeline.e5Text: Appointed as NEDO NEP Frontier Course 2025 FR
Timeline.e6Text: Worked as AI Engineer at ProxIndustries Inc., a Matsuo Lab spinoff startup
Timeline.e7Text: Worked as Tech Lead at ONIXION Inc.
Timeline.e9Text: Founded KUPAC (Kyoto University Physical AI Community), appointed as Representative
Timeline.e10Text: Established KUPAC LLC, appointed as Representative Member

Contact.title: Contact
Contact.description: I welcome inquiries about work opportunities, technical discussions, and anything related to KUPAC. Feel free to reach out.

Metadata.description: Portfolio of an engineer driving real-world Physical AI through Management × Engineering. Kyoto Univ. Economics | NEDO NEP FR
